intro: Hieracium schmidtii subsp. subvandasii, commonly known as the Schmidt's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, grassy habitats such as meadows and pastures, preferring well-drained soils. It has finely divided, serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
